availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Elizabeth Spalding Hite in Union County on August 1, 1836. Father of Thomas J. Hite, Susan Hite, Benjamin Hite, Hettie Hite, Sarah W. Hite, Mary C. Hite, Catharine Hite, Robert D. Hite, and Elizabeth Hite. Farmer in Union County in 1850. Employed Lewis Baird as a laborer in Union County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Union County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film #000562196, p. 101.
